text: Alfred Thomas "Freddie" HighmoreBirths, Marriages & Deaths Index of England & Wales, 1984–2004, listed birth name as "Alfred Thomas Highmore". (born 14 February 1992) is an English Actor and Director. He is known for his film roles in Women Talking Dirty (1999), Finding Neverland (2004), Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005), and The Spiderwick Chronicles (2008). He has appeared as a television actor in 2 TV series: as Norman Bates in the A&E; drama series Bates Motel (2013–2017), and as autistic resident surgeon Dr. Shaun Murphy in The Good Doctor (2017–2020) on ABC TV. Highmore won a Saturn Award in 2007. He also twice won the Critic's Choice awards for Best Young Performer in a film. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Saturn Award winners Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:English movie actors Category:English television actors Category:English stage actors Category:English voice actors Category:English child actors Category:English television directors Category:English television producers Category:Screenwriters from London Category:Actors from London
title: Freddie Highmore
